file_content.text: They will not! I command them to know fear, to raise me to my throne! They cannot!
I have waited twenty thousand years, but I will wait no longer.
The blood of a lesser species.
Know now the face of my slaves. Know the army that was buried alongside me, to serve me unto death.
When you fall, it is they who will march upon the stars. They will reclaim my galaxy.
They come marching, believing themselves equal to the army of ancients that chained me.
But I am not of their time. Their ancestors called me Soa, wrath and power, and knew fear.
For I ruled a thousand worlds, and Korriban was my crown, Korriban my cradle and my testing ground.
My finest creation, machine of machines, metal enemies welded together and allied toward destruction.
Silentior lived to obliterate the Rakata who opposed me, who did not realize I had risen above them.
It decimated armies, and it lives for destruction still.
Hear it howl, for it was bred to scream, blood and fibers woven into a devouring beast.
It was Gharj whose claws scored the canals of Seylott; Gharj who consumed the natives of Alzoc, and was worshiped for it.
Gharj whom the alchemists of a younger age sought to emulate, but all would fail. Look upon Gharj, and die.
They slay not knowing that I am the seed of destruction in their hearts. I am master and creator, what the galaxy fears.
I hear them enter my domain, children unknowing. They will serve.
